info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 21 at 10:01AM CDT by NWS Aberdeen SD
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Grand River Near Little Eagle affecting Corson County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...
Oak Creek near Wakpala affecting Corson County.
.For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Oak Creek near Wakpala.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, water reaches the bottom of the bridge just northwest of the gage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM MDT Wednesday was 11.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1245 AM MDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
